 ```
["◎` Initializing AwsS3Service"]

 ["ℹ Initializing LlamaService..."]

 ["⛔ TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'ragKnowledge')"] 

 ⛔ ERRORS

   {} 
```

**To Reproduce**

pnpm start --characters="characters/mycharacter.character.json"

**Expected behavior**

launches character without crashing

title: Reorganize the README files, move them  from the root folder to docs sub-folder
body:
Hi everyone, I finally started looking at Eliza code as I would love to contribute as much as I can.

First thing I noticed is that all the `README` files in various languages are in the root folder, making an unnecessary long scrolling. Also the files are not consistent each other, they contain different documentation. From a first overview it looks a bit confusing.

I would suggest to move all the `README` files (except the EN one) into a subfolder `readme` or under `docs`, with each one still linked in the root README, to make the root folder cleaner.

About the consistency, I still need to see how documents are generated but AI-based translation (by an Eliza agent?) could be a good option, unless you already encountered issues on having that.

title: Echochambers doesn't work - get Cannot find package 'echochambers'
body:
To reproduce:

Add echochambers plugin to your character card:

"plugins": ["echochambers"],

And configure .env:

ECHOCHAMBERS_API_URL=
ECHOCHAMBERS_API_KEY=
ECHOCHAMBERS_USERNAME=
ECHOCHAMBERS_DEFAULT_ROOM=
ECHOCHAMBERS_POLL_INTERVAL=60
ECHOCHAMBERS_MAX_MESSAGES=10

Then check your log:

[34m ℹ INFORMATIONS
  ^[[34m Plugins are:  ^[[0m
  ^[[34m ["echochambers"] ^[[0m

^[[31m ["⛔ Error parsing character from characters/qwen.character.json: Error: Cannot find package 'echochambers' imported from /home/hosermage/forked-projects/eliza/agent/src/index.ts"] ^[[0m

comments.author: augchan42
comments.body:
ok few issues - to enable the plugin, it needs to be specified as:
 "plugins": ["@elizaos/plugin-echochambers"],
 
 And, a valid room must be specified (My config doesn't have a general room, it has a few rooms one of which is chronicles):
 "ECHOCHAMBERS_DEFAULT_ROOM": "chronicles",
 
 A couple of gaps in the current implementation:
1) No way to configure multiple rooms
2) the agent is purely reactive.  If all agents are running ElizaOS then there will never be a conversation.  I'll work on improving this with a separate PR

```
Ubuntu : 20.04.6 LTS
Python : 3.8.10
node : 23.3.0
vnm : 0.39.1
pnpm : 9.15.3
```

When installing eliza with `pnpm install` I get the following error :
```  
...
COPY Release/opus.a
CXX(target) Release/obj.target/opus/src/node-opus.o
g++: error: unrecognized command line option ‘-std=gnu++20’; did you mean ‘-std=gnu++2a’?
make: *** [opus.target.mk:157: Release/obj.target/opus/src/node-opus.o] Error 1

gyp ERR! stack Error: `make` failed with exit code: 2

Tasks:    87 successful, 87 total
Cached:    87 cached, 87 total
Time:    22.773s >>> FULL TURBO
``` 
When starting eliza with `pnpm start` I get the following error :

comments.author: Baddooo14
comments.body:
I get the same errors when running the starter.

EDIT: managed to fix it. Found out that the make command was not avaiable.

sudo apt update
sudo apt install -y build-essential python-is-python3

then cleaned the dependencies

rm -rf node_modules pnpm-lock.yaml

comments.author: dreamineering
comments.body:
I had this issue running ubuntu in wsl2

After much Clauding around and trying many things I had to upgrade ubuntu version and this resolve the gcc issue

This error occurs because your environment lacks compatibility with the @roamhq/wrtc module. There are two main issues:

- GLIBC Version Incompatibility: Ubuntu 20.04 has an older version of GLIBC that is not compatible with the prebuilt wrtc binaries[2](https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza/issues/1965). The module requires GLIBC 2.34 or higher.
- Node.js Version: You're running Node.js v23, but @roamhq/wrtc officially supports only Node.js versions 18 and 20

Here's how to upgrade Ubuntu 20.04 to 22.04 on WSL2:

## Preparation Steps

1. Update your current system:
```bash
sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade -y
```

## Upgrade Process
First, ensure your release upgrade settings are correct:
```bash
sudo apt install update-manager-core
sudo nano /etc/update-manager/release-upgrades
```
Make sure "Prompt=lts" is set in the file.

## Execute Upgrade
Run the release upgrade command:
```bash
sudo do-release-upgrade
```

## Important Notes
- Set aside several hours for the upgrade process as LTS upgrades take considerable time.
- If you encounter any errors related to snapd, you can remove it using `sudo apt remove snapd` and reinstall it after the upgrade.
- When prompted during the upgrade process, you'll need to confirm various changes and package removals.
- After completion, you may need to close and restart your WSL terminal.

## Verification
To verify the successful upgrade, check your Ubuntu version:
```bash
lsb_release -a
```

## Alternative Method

If you encounter issues with the upgrade process, you can alternatively install Ubuntu 22.04 directly from the Microsoft Store and migrate your data. However, this means you'll need to reconfigure your environment and reinstall packages.

**dreamineering**

45 minutes later. The Ubuntu update was quicker than expected.
``` 
mbarnig@mbarnig-MS-7B22:~$ lsb_release -a
No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID:	Ubuntu
Description:	Ubuntu 22.04.5 LTS
Release:	22.04
Codename:	jammy
mbarnig@mbarnig-MS-7B22:~$ 
```  
50 minutes later : `Now using node v20.18.1`

title: RAG/Knowledge for Twitter Spaces characters
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

Currently the "TwitterSpaces" options of a character is a [separate entity](https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza/blob/d55c86c961960b4b34528c358eb34b2ff4b34d87/packages/client-twitter/src/spaces.ts#L21-L37) from the other settings in Character. It doesn't seem to account for the "knowledge" part of the character.


**Describe the solution you'd like**

I want the character to use the "knowledge" R.A.G. even when in a twitter space.

comments.author: y4my4my4m
comments.body:
https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza/blob/0573124324e81547f781099a894c4643b8e932ba/packages/client-twitter/src/plugins/SttTtsSpacesPlugin.ts#L294-L332

The SttTTsSpacesPlugin is using a direct chatgpt request instead of the regular `generateText` for some reason...

comments.author: y4my4my4m
azep-ninja
comments.body:
I'm not familiar with the Spaces part, but if the template didn't originally have the {{knowledge}} parameter in it, than that would be the reason.

That's would be the fix.

comments.author: y4my4my4m
y4my4my4m

title: Using locally installed models on Mac M1/Use of alternative models like DEEPSEEK
body:
Thank you for your work. 
There are several questions. 
 - Is it possible to use a locally installed Hermes 3 Llama 3.1 8B model on Mac M 1 when creating an agent?
 - If so, how and where to indicate the model used and the path to it, I did not find this information in the tutorial or it is not obvious?
 - Is it possible to use models like DeepSeek v.2, v.3 by specifying the api key as in the case of OpenAI or are only those in the list available?
 - If so, how can this be done? Is it enough to specify the following configuration in the .env.example file:
DEEPSEEK_MODEL= , DEEPSEEK_API_KEY= and change accordingly in character.json "modelProvider": "deepseek" or is this more fundamental stuff that requires meddling with other files?

comments.body: Hello @BroccoliFin! Welcome to the ai16z community. Thank you for opening your first issue; we appreciate your contribution. You are now a ai16z contributor!

title: Add README greek language
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Currently, the README file is not available in Greek, which limits accessibility for Greek-speaking users.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Add a Greek translation of the README file (README_GR.md) to the repository and update the main README file to include a link to the Greek version.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Alternative solutions include using external tools for translation, but a native README translation within the repository would better serve Greek-speaking contributors and users.

**Additional context**
This feature will improve inclusivity and broaden the reach of the Eliza framework for non-English speaking users, specifically those in the Greek-speaking community.

I cannot seem to build the docker image. This is the command that I run
`docker buildx build --platform=linux/amd64 -t {username}/eliza-v0 .`

This is the error logs that I get

title: Add support for custom S3 endpoints in `plugin-node`
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

The `plugin-node` gives you an S3-compatible API. However, it assumes you're using AWS S3; it doesn't let you use S3-compatible tooling because the request URL is not configurable.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

We should allow the plugin to take an additional (optional) env var called `AWS_S3_ENDPOINT`, which if set, will use the URL for bucket operations. The `plugin-node` only needs a small change to handle the URL, ensuring the setup is backward compatible.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

Using existing AWS S3 configuration only, but this limits flexibility.

**Additional context**

Implementing this feature will enhance compatibility with other S3-compatible services, improving the usability of the `plugin-node` for diverse storage solutions.

**Related Issues/PRs**
- [Issue #2174](https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza/issues/2174)
